alert.note: Alert for Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:23PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Laurel, north central Knox, west central Leslie, south central Jackson and central Clay Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1023 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near London to McHargue to Ogle. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lipps, Brightshade, Ogle, Botto and Goose Rock around 1030 PM EDT. Plank around 1035 PM EDT. Sasser, Bush, Lake, Marydell, Sprule, Woollum and Haven around 1040 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Crawford, Marcum, Creekville, Cottongin, Jonsee, Portersburg, Spring Creek, Hooker, Urban, Fogertown, Benge, Hima, Sibert, Herron, Pigeonroost, Bluehole, House, Park Valley, Datha, Manchester, Horse Creek Junction, Hosea, Littleton, Grace, High Knob, Sidell, Boho and Egypt. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 27. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 36 and 42. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 9 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
